intro: Ilex walkeri, commonly known as the Chinese holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, bright red berries. The plant typically grows in temperate climates and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal berries. Ilex walkeri is also valued for its hardiness and ability to tolerate a range of environmental conditions.
